metadata.title: CVE-2024-36946 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: phonet:fix rtm_phonet_notify() skb allocation fill_route() stores three componentsin the skb: - struct rtmsg - RTA_DST (u8) - RTA_OIF (u32) Therefore,rtm_phonet_notify() should use NLMSG_ALIGN(sizeof(struct rtmsg)) +nla_total_size(1) + nla_total_size(4)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36946` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-lowlatency - 4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-aws - 4.4.0-1139.145
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.145').
linux-azure package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1184.199~14.04.1').
